oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tips and Tools for Troubleshooting Nutritional Management on Dairy Herds
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Oetzel, Garrett R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: nutritional management
dairy cattle
nutritionists
diet formulation
feed
dairy clients
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Veterinarians can play an important role in troubleshooting nutritional management problems on dairy herds. While nutritionists typically do the bulk of these activities, veterinarians bring a different and complementary perspective to nutritional management. Specific areas where veterinarians may become involved include evaluating diet formulation, individual feed ingredients, feed mixes or the total mixed ration, consistency and frequency of feed delivery, and amount of feed called for each pen. Dairy clients receive the best consulting services possible when there is a healthy respect and appropriate tension between veterinarians and nutritionists.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2010; 105-109
